12 (b) 64 [2 marks]

12 (c) 4n [2 marks]

12 (d) [6 marks total]  
   • (2 AO2.2, 4 AO2.4b)  

 Number of blacks is always even (“oe”) and reason  
 Number of dots alternates between odd and even (“oe”) and reason  

 even + even = even  
 odd + even = odd  

 – B1  
 – B1  
 – B1  
 – B1  
 – B1  
 – B1  

Accept “4 times table” or “4 is even.”  
Accept any reason that has explanatory value (e.g. odd² = odd).  

If 0 scored, instead award:  
   – B1 shows true for patterns 1, 2 and 3  
   – B1 shows true for at least two more patterns

13.text:

• Any straight line through the origin (e.g. y = 2x)

(a)(ii)  
• A cubic with two turning points  
• 2 marks in total (1 AO1.1, 1 AO2.3b)  
 ─ B1 for a cubic with two turning points  

(b)(i)  
• At least one point plotted correctly  
• 1 mark (1 AO2.3b)  

(b)(ii)  
• 3 marks in total (1 AO2.3b, 1 AO3.1b, 1 AO3.2)  
 ─ B2 for at least 5 points correctly plotted  
   OR  
   B1 for at least 3 points correctly plotted  
   AND  
   B1 for a curve drawn through their points

15.text:
15  
Answer: 25, 30, 17 (with correct working)  
Marks: 5 (2 AO1.3a, 2 AO3.1d, 1 AO3.3)  

• M1 for x – 8 + x + x + 5 = 72  
• M1FT for 3x – 3 = 72  
• M1FT for 3x = 75 implied by x = 25  

AND  

• M1 for substituting their 25 into (x – 8) and (x + 5)  

Alternative method using trials:  
• M3 for a correctly evaluated trial of (x – 8 + x + x + 5) with x = 25  
  OR  
• M2 for at least two complete correct evaluations of (x – 8 + x + x + 5)  
  OR  
• M1 for at least one complete correct evaluation of (x – 8 + x + x + 5)  

AND  

• M1 for substituting their 25 into (x – 8) and (x + 5)  

If 0 or 1 mark scored, instead award SC2 for 25, 30, 17 with no working or insufficient working.  

If 0 scored, instead award SC1 for x = 25 with no working or insufficient working.  

“Correct working” requires evidence of at least M1M1M1 or M3.  

Methods shown use Kieran as x; apply similar schemes if using Jermaine or Chris as the subject.  

Note: x = 25 scores M1M1M1 if there is some supporting work but on its own scores SC1.

18.text:
Question 18

Answer (4 marks: 2 AO1.3a, 2 AO2.2)

Average speed = Distance ÷ Time

= 5x km/h

= 21000 ÷ (60 × 5x) m/s

= 1000 ÷ (18000x) m/s (oe)

= 18x m/s

Part marks and guidance:

• B1 for x km = 1000x m  
• B1 for 5 hours = 60 × 60 × 5 = 18000 s  
• B1 for working to the given answer without intermediate expression or statement of formula

19.text:
19    25 with correct working    5 marks  
(2 AO1.3b, 3 AO3.1d)

• M1 for (2/10 × 45) = … litres red  
  or for (3/10 × 65) = … litres white  

• M1 for red costs £8 per litre  
  or for white costs £0.50 per litre  

• M1 for cost of one 10-litre can is  
 (their 4 × their 8) + (their 6 × their 0.5)  

• M1 for 60 – their 35  

If 0 or 1 scored, instead award SC2 for answer 25 with no working or insufficient working  
“Correct working” requires evidence of at least M1M1  

Alternative method:  
• M1 for 2 : 3 = 20 litres red : 30 litres white  
• M1 for (2 × £80) + (3 × £5) = £175  
• M1 for (175 ÷ 5) = 35  
• M1 for 60 – their 35

Question 21
